column3: For Greek philosophers and thinkers, justice was equated with ____?
___________ is best known as the cradle of Western scholarship?
In pre-colonial era, most Nigerian communities were_____?
Accordingly, to Plato, the four virtues that made a good individual, include justice,_____, courage and temperance?
The formulation of a national policy on education took place in the year ______ ?
Most of the laws governing traditional African society were ______ based?
In traditional Africa, ancestors were regarded as _________ and they played a major role in the society?
Some Igala elites attribute the emergence of their state to one _______?
One of this is the obligation of a citizen?
Placing the interest of the State before any other interest
Defending the State against internal and external enemies
In ________ the Nigerian government introduced the Universal Basic Education Programme (UBE)?
There are at least ____ activity sectors of the Nigerian economy?
Before independence, Nigeria arable land is estimated to be about___ million hectares?
As Nana is to Itsekiri, so is ______ to Benin?
when a group of people occupying a defined territory acquires the citizenship privileges of another either by treaty or by statute annexing the territory to a new one is known as ____?
Historically _____ resistance the British in Sokoto, just like Jaja of Opobo?
The year _________ the Hausa population was estimated at about twenty million?
The _____ people groups in Nigeria are found also in Senegal, Gambia, Guinea, Guinea Bissau, Mali and Benin?
The First amalgamation in Nigeria was between these two protectorate ____?
Lagos colony and The Norther protectorate
Protectorate of Southern Nigeria and Lagos colony
Protectorate of Western Nigeria and Lagos colony
Protectorate of Southern Nigeria and The Norther protectorate

It was only in the year _____ that the declaration of the Rights of Man issued by the National Assembly of France during the French Revolution gave a universal and an unbiased dimension to citizenship?
Besides the Ijaw and the Itsekiri, ____ communities have proved their best skills in the oil palm production technology except?
In Niger Delta Region of Nigeria the clan or the village group is a _____?
The farmers, petty civil servants, craftsmen and traders in the Sudan Savanna belong to the ____ class?
The Edoid culture group include the following except ___ ?
Among the Igbo of Nigeria ____ is the link between his people and the ancestors?
The following people groups except ___ are well known for their strong belief in witchcraft, magic and sorcery?
Any person born within the territorial jurisdiction of a State is automatically a citizen of that State irrespective of the citizenship of the parents, this is known as ___?
___ ethnic group believe that only women are  witches?
In _______ the tertiary education witnessed a tremendous improvement with the adoption of the 6-3-3-4 system?
The following communities except ____ are known for iron smelting as their major business?
Some scholars argue that the Igala are of a ________ extraction?
The attachment to deities is so powerful in Ile-Ife, with as many as _____deities with official religious activities devoted to them?
The army of Kanem Bornu was very professional. It was divided strategically into ________ divisions?
In the year 1970, the Sudan Savanna area accounted for ____ of the total guinea corn output in Nigeria?
In the year 1960 the _______ sector absorbed over 75 percent of the work force?
